00001 /*************************************************************************************
00002 interpretation by Maciek
00003 
00004 the executed test program peforms the action/command defined by providing appropratate argument,
00005 command is performed on a particular channel of choosen device (minor number) on a VME specified 
00006 by the address
00007 
00008 everything is defined by the arguments inputed when invoking program
00009 *************************************************************************************/

00025 pscip_t val;
00026 // typedef struct {
00027 //   unsigned  int  chan;   /* channel 0/1 */
00028 //   unsigned  char  stat,    /* status register */ 
00029 //      address;   /* address register */

00032 /********************************************************************************
00033 how to start the program:
00034 $ executable <devidx(0,1..20)> <chan(0,1)> <address> <r/w/a/t> <data type(i,x,f)> <value(only write)> \n",argv[0]);
00035 
00036 parameter:
00037 - <devidx(0,1..20)> - device index
00038 - <chan(0,1)>   - chanal
00039 - <address>   - adress - address passed by fiber to the power supply, not vme addres!!!!!!!!!!
00040 - <r/w/a/t>  - read/write/write wave/read wave
00041 - <data type(i,x,f)> - data type??: integer, hex, float
00042 - <value(only write)> - value, if writing
00043 ********************************************************************************/
00044 static char psc_errmsg[][PSCIP_SIZE_MSG] = {
00045  "Echo value doesn't match", 
00046  "Remote control disabled",
00047  "Generic reading error", 
00048  "Data timeout",
00049  "Input buffer full",
00050  "Dsp stopped",
00051  "Link is down",
00052  "Transmission error", 
00053  "Parameter error",
00054  "VME bus error" 
00055 };
00056 /*
00057  * pscip_get_errmsg()
00058  * Convert error code in a error message
00059  */
00060  
00061 
00062  static char *pscip_get_errmsg(int err)
00063 {
00064  int offset = err - PSCIP_IOCTL_MAGIC;
00065  if ((offset >= 0) && (offset < (sizeof(psc_errmsg)/PSCIP_SIZE_MSG))) 
00066   return psc_errmsg[offset];
00067    
00068  return "Linux error message";
00069 
00070  return 0;  //added for 2.6 - temporary to avoid warnings 
00071 } 
00072 /* pscip_get_errmsg() */
